stream_context.summary: Kaze spends a bonus Christmas stream blocking-out the Wild-West course and polishing Oily Boily Bay.  He roughs-in town props, lays out a second ‘surreal canyon’ zone, models colour-coded warp pipes, and times an intro cut-scene to music.  Much of the time is spent live-prototyping geometry, textures, spline cameras and fixing a crash.

development_findings.summary: Wild-West course will contain a town hub (milk bar, Koopa bank, sheriff’s office, cactuses, train, windmills) plus a canyon section full of giant symbolic props (shotgun, wheel, shed, skull, hoof iron) used for a clue-chasing treasure star.
development_findings.quote: “There’s a guy that stands here… he gives you the first hint.  You ground-pound inside the big skull, the sign sends you all over the area.”

development_findings.summary: Four coloured warp pipes (red-orange-yellow-grey) act as shortcuts between the town and canyon set-pieces.
development_findings.quote: “The yellow one leads to the yellow one and the gray one leads to the gray one and so on.”

development_findings.summary: Created new higher-poly, shiny pipe model; balanced texture, lighting and colour-blind readability while keeping it one-cycle for real N64.
Finished three-shot intro cut-scene for Oily Boily Bay: building ➔ Bowser statue ➔ scaffolds, timed to drum beats.
development_findings.quote: “The most important part of the cutscene for me is that it’s fitting to the music.”

development_findings.summary: Star/mission name pass for Oily Boily Bay: Trouble the Troops, Strike Breaker (boss), Power Plant Platforming, etc.; names may still change.
Game will be 15 courses, ≤64 MB, open-source and cartridge-compatible; any larger size would feel like cheating.
development_findings.quote: “One of my conditions [is] that it fits on a normal N64 cartridge. I’m not going to go above 64 megabytes.”

development_findings.summary: Badub scores ‘all my levels nowadays’; Oily Boily Bay still needs a song; Biobak to finish some unfinished collision/underground art.
development_findings.quote: “We also still need a song… Biobak said he would finish this area.”

development_findings.summary: Debugged a crash caused by coloured pipe objects via NEMU64 PC trace; demonstrates reliance on assembly-level debugging.
development_findings.quote: “Who needs debug symbols if you’re just really, really good at assembly.”

development_findings.summary: Kaze dislikes Parallel Launcher; uses Project64 for convenience and NEMU64 for accurate debugging.
development_findings.quote: “Parallel launcher tarts can’t just let me not use parallel launcher in peace.”

development_findings.summary: Floated future ROM-hack concept: 10 easy levels, 20 non-ejective stars, minimal friction—‘Odyssey-like’—believes it would be extremely popular.
development_findings.quote: “Games are just so goddamn bad that if you make a game that is just not offensive… people will love it.”

context_findings.summary: Philosophy: values ‘sleek design’ without over-explanation; embraces accessible, frustration-free gameplay.
context_findings.quote: “Sometimes you just have to have a sleek design that doesn’t over-explain itself.”

context_findings.summary: Shows frustration when chat insists on Parallel Launcher; marks bump in viewers since dual-streaming.
Personal: Christmas spent playing Smash Remix; gifts included Mewtwo model kit, candy, shampoo, jacket, air fryer.
Financial: cannot monetise hack to avoid Nintendo risk; still employed at Gears for Breakfast; trouble paying Biobak because PayPal locked.
context_findings.quote: “I want to pay Biobak with paper money but PayPal is not letting me use PayPal right now.”

biobak.summary: Responsible for finishing collision and visual polish in Oily Boily Bay and the Wild-West underground; payment currently blocked, so status uncertain.
biobak.quote: “Biobak said he would finish this area… I don’t know if he’s actually working on stuff or not.”

badub.summary: Composes music for Kaze’s levels; scored current Wild-West map; will need to write a track for Oily Boily Bay.
badub.quote: “Who made the music for this level? Badub. He always makes the music for my levels nowadays at least.”

zeina.summary: Modelling the giant skull prop for the canyon section; also provides personal support (food, chat moderation).
zeina.quote: “Oh, that looks really good, Zeina… This is the skeleton, Zeina.”

key_stories.title: Building the Oily Boily Bay Intro
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants an opening camera that matches the drum beats.  He roughs three spline segments, iteratively tweaks frame counts, and syncs cuts to music until satisfied.
key_stories.challenge: Syncing camera pans to specific beats felt ‘hard to cut on this beat’.
key_stories.process: Adjusted spline timings, tested repeatedly, increased music volume to judge beats.
key_stories.outcome: Final three-part cut-scene accepted; ready to reintegrate into level.
key_stories.key_quote: “All I want to change is that the last one is a bit later, so that when we cut back to Mario, it’s on beat.”

key_stories.title: Coloured Warp Pipe Crash
key_stories.summary: After adding four colour-coded pipes, the ROM crashed on load.  Kaze used NEMU64 to trace the PC and discovered the crash was inside his new geoset function.
key_stories.challenge: Unexplained crash when level loaded with new pipe objects.
key_stories.process: Commented out pipes, confirmed stability, ran emulator with PC trace, identified bad pointer, fixed code.
key_stories.outcome: Pipes now render and warp correctly with distinct colours.
key_stories.key_quote: “Who needs debug symbols—the simulator gave me the exact PC of the crash.”

key_stories.title: Paying Biobak
key_stories.summary: PayPal locked Kaze’s account, preventing him from paying the graphics artist.
key_stories.challenge: Cannot transfer money via PayPal; considering crypto but hates fees/tax issues.
key_stories.process: Explores bank transfer or crypto workaround; complains about taxation complexity.
key_stories.outcome: Unresolved; may delay Biobak’s asset delivery.
key_stories.key_quote: “I still need to buy fucking crypto just to pay Biobak… I’d literally just rather send a bank transfer.”
